CHAPTER 705
Adult Entertainment Dancers
705.01   Definitions.
705.02   Permits required.
705.03   Application for dancers for adult entertainment business permit.
705.04   Application for dancer’s permit.
705.05   Approval by the Chief of Police.
705.06   Sanitation and safety requirements.
705.07   Location.
705.08   Restrictions.
705.09   Nudity; sexual conduct prohibited.
705.10   Issuance or denial of dancers for adult entertainment business permit.
705.11   Display of permits.
705.12   Fee.
705.13   Revocation or suspension of permit.
705.14   Transfers prohibited.
705.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Obscenity and sex offenses - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
533
Massage parlors - see BUS. REG. Ch.
725
Video viewing units - see BUS. REG. Ch.
737
 
 
705.01 DEFINITIONS.
   Unless the particular provision or the context otherwise requires, the
definitions and provisions contained in this section shall govern the
construction, meaning and application of words and phrases used in this
chapter.
   (a)    "Employee" means any person over eighteen (18) years of age, other
than a dancer who renders any service in connection with the operation of a
business and receives compensation from the operator of the business or
patrons.
   (b)    "Dancing" means to move with the feet or body rhythmically and in a
more or less set succession of movements usually performed to music
accompaniment.
   (c)    "Dancer" means any person who engages in the practice of dancing as
herein defined. The use of the masculine gender shall include in all cases the
feminine gender as well.
   (d)    "Sexual contact" means any touching of an erogenous zone of another,
including without limitation, the thigh, genitals, buttock, pubic region or, if
such person is a female, a breast, for the purpose of sexually arousing or
gratifying either person, and is not included within the term dancing as used
herein.
   (e)    "Patron" means any person over eighteen (18) years of age who
patronizes such businesses under such circumstances that it is reasonably
expected that he or she will pay money or give any other consideration
therefor.
      (Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.02 PERMITS REQUIRED.
   (a)    Business Permit Required. No person shall engage in or carry on the
business of dancers for adult entertainment unless he has a valid dancers for
adult entertainment business permit issued by the City pursuant to the
provisions of this chapter for each and every separate office or place of
business conducted by such person.
   (b)    Dancer's Permit Required. No person shall practice dancing as a
dancer employee or otherwise, unless he/she has a valid and subsisting dancer's
permit issued to him/her by the City pursuant to the provisions of this
chapter.
(Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.03 APPLICATION FOR DANCERS FOR ADULT ENTERTAINMENT BUSINESS PERMIT.
   Any person desiring a dancers for adult entertainment permit shall file a
written application with the Director of Administration on a form to be
furnished by the Director of Administration. The applicant shall accompany the
application with a tender of the correct permit fee as hereinafter provided and
shall, in addition, furnish the following:
   (a)    The type of ownership of the business, i.e., whether individual,
partnership, corporation or otherwise.
   (b)    The name, style and designation under which the business or practice
is to be conducted.
   (c)    The business address and all telephone numbers where the business is
to be conducted.
   (d)    A complete list of the names and residence addresses of all dancers
and employees in the business and the name and residence address of the manager
or other person principally in charge of the operation of the business.
   (e)    The following personal information concerning the applicant, if an
individual, and concerning each stockholder holding more than ten percent (10%)
of the stock of the corporation, each officer and each director, if the
applicant is a corporation, and concerning the partners, including limited
partners, if the applicant is a partnership; and concerning the manager or
other person principally in charge of the operation of the business:
      (1)   Name, complete residence address and residence telephone numbers.
      (2)   Two previous addresses immediately prior to the present address of
the applicant.
      (3)   Written proof of age.
      (4)   Height, weight, color of hair and eyes and sex.
      (5)   Two front-face portrait photographs taken within thirty days of the
date of the application and at least two inches by two inches in size.
      (6)   All criminal convictions other than misdemeanor traffic violations,
fully disclosing the jurisdiction in which convicted, and the offense for which
convicted and the circumstances thereof.
      (7)   A complete set of fingerprints taken and to be retained on file by
the Police Chief or his authorized representatives.
   (f)   Such other information, identification and physical examination of the
person as shall be deemed necessary by the Police Chief to discover the truth
of the matters hereinbefore required to be set forth in the application.
   (g)    Authorization for the City, its agents and employees to seek
information and conduct an investigation into the truth of the statements set
forth in the application and the qualifications of the applicant for the
permit.
   (h)   Written declaration by the applicant, under penalty of perjury, that
the foregoing information contained in the application is true and correct,
such declaring being duly dated and signed by the City.
      (Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.04 APPLICATION FOR DANCER'S PERMIT.
   Any person desiring a Dancer's Permit shall file a written application with
the Director of Administration on a form to be furnished by the Director of
Administration. The applicant shall tender with the application the correct
permit fees as hereinafter provided and shall, in addition, furnish the
following:
   (a)    The business address and telephone numbers where the dancing is to be
performed.
   (b)    The following personal information concerning the applicant:
      (1)   Name, complete residence address and residence telephone numbers.
      (2)   The two previous addresses immediately prior to the present address
of the applicant.
      (3)   Written proof of age.
      (4)   Height, weight, color of hair and eyes and sex.
      (5)   Two front face portrait photographs taken within thirty days of the
date of application and at least two inches by two inches in size.
      (6)   All criminal convictions other than misdemeanor traffic violations,
fully disclosing the jurisdiction in which convicted, and the offense for which
convicted and the circumstances thereof.
      (7)   A complete set of fingerprints taken and to be retained on file by
the Police Chief or his authorized representative.
   (c)    Such other information, identification and physical examination of
the person deemed necessary by the Police Chief in order to discover the truth
of the matters hereinbefore required to be set forth in the application.
   (d)    Authorization for the City, its agents and employees to seek
information and conduct an investigation into the truth of the statements set
forth in the application and the qualifications of the applicant for the
permit.
   (e)    Written declaration by the applicant, under penalty of perjury, that
the foregoing information contained in the application is true and correct,
such declaration being duly dated and signed by the City.
      (Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.05 APPROVAL BY THE CHIEF OF POLICE.
   Upon receiving the application for a Dancers for Adult Entertainment
business or Dancer’s permit, the Police Chief shall conduct an investigation
into the applicant's moral character and personal and criminal history. The
Police Chief may, in his discretion, require a personal interview of the
applicant, and such further information, identification and physical
examination of the person as shall bear on the investigation. In the case of
applications for Dancers for Adult Entertainment business permits, the Police
Chief shall cause to be conducted an investigation of the premises where the
Dancers for Adult Entertainment business is to be carried on, for the purposes
of assuring that such premises comply with all the sanitation requirements as
set forth in this chapter and with the regulations of public health, safety and
welfare. Before any permit shall be issued under this chapter, the Police Chief
and Director of Administration shall first sign their approval of the
application.
(Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.06 SANITATION AND SAFETY REQUIREMENTS.
   All premises used by permittees hereunder shall be periodically inspected by
the Police Chief and/or an authorized inspector for safety of the structure and
adequacy of plumbing, ventilation, heating, illumination and cleanliness. No
Dancing shall be carried on within any cubicle, room, booth, or any area within
such establishment which is fitted with a door capable of being locked. Nothing
contained herein shall be construed to eliminate other requirements of statute
or ordinance concerning the maintenance of premises, nor to preclude authorized
inspection thereof. All premises used by permittees hereunder shall be
periodically inspected by the Police Chief, Health Commissioner, the Building
Inspector and/or their authorized representative.
(Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.07 LOCATION.
   (a)    Each business featuring dancers for adult entertainment, as herein
above described, is hereby prohibited from operating within 500 feet of any
church, school (public or private), library, public playground, park or private
residence.
   (b)    Five hundred feet as used hereinabove, shall be determined by
measuring the distance from the nearest property line of the land on which the
proposed licensed premises is located to the nearest property lines of land on
which such institutions or public or private places as hereinabove described
are located.
(Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.08 RESTRICTIONS.
   Each business that features Dancers for Adult Entertainment as hereinabove
described, is hereby prohibited from the sale of intoxicating liquor upon the
premises.
(Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.09 NUDITY; SEXUAL CONDUCT PROHIBITED.
   (a)    No person shall expose to public view his or her genitals, pubic
area, vulva, anus, anal cleft or cleavage, or any portion of the foregoing
specified anatomical areas, or any simulation thereof in any establishment
which features Dancers for Adult Entertainment.
   (b)    No female person shall expose to public view any portion of her
breasts encompassed within an area falling below the horizontal line one would
have to draw to intersect a point above the top of the areola, or any portion
of the areola, or any simulation thereof in any establishment which features
Dancers for Adult Entertainment.
   (c)    No person maintaining, owning, or operating an establishment which
features Dancers for Adult Entertainment shall suffer or permit any person to
expose to public view his or her genitals, pubic area, vulva, anus, anal cleft
or cleavage, or any portion of the foregoing specified anatomical areas, or
simulation thereof, within any establishment which features Dancers for Adult
Entertainment.
   (d)    No person maintaining, owning or operating an establishment which
features Dancers for Adult Entertainment shall suffer or permit any female
person to expose to the public view any portion of her breasts encompassed
within an area falling below the horizontal line one would have to draw to
intersect a point immediately above the top of the areola, or any portion of
the areola, or any simulation thereof, within any establishment at which
alcoholic beverages beer or wine are sold or offered for sale or consumption on
the premises. This definition shall include the entire lower portion of the
human female breast, but shall not include any portion of the cleavage of the
human breast exhibited by a dress, blouse, shirt, leotard, bathing suit or
other wearing apparel, provided the areola is not so exposed.
   (e)    No person shall engage in and no person maintaining, owning, or
operating an establishment which features Dancers for Adult Entertainment shall
suffer or permit any sexual intercourse, masturbation, sodomy, bestiality, oral
copulation, flagellation, any sexual act which is prohibited by law, touching,
caressing, or fondling of the breasts, buttocks or any portion thereof, anus or
genitals or the simulation thereof, within any establishment at which features
Dancers for Adult Entertainment. (Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.10 ISSUANCE OR DENIAL OF DANCERS FOR ADULT ENTERTAINMENT BUSINESS PERMIT.
   The Police Chief shall issue a Dancers for Adult Entertainment business
permit within forty-five days of receipt of the application unless he finds
that:
   (a)    The correct permit fee has not been tendered to the City, and, in the
case of a check or bank draft, honored with payment upon presentation;
   (b)    The operation, as proposed by the applicant, if permitted, would not
comply with all applicable laws, including, but not limited to, the City's
building, zoning and health regulations;
   (c)    The applicant, if an individual, or any of the stockholders holding
more than ten percent of the stock of the corporation, or any of the officers
and directors, if the application is a corporation; or any of the partners,
including limited partners, if the application is a partnership; and the
manager or other person principally in charge of the operation of the business,
have been convicted of any crime involving dishonesty, fraud, or deceit, unless
conviction occurred at least five years prior to the date of the application;
   (d)    The applicant has knowingly made any false, misleading or fraudulent
statement of fact in the permit application or in any document required by the
City in conjunction therewith;
   (e)    The applicant has had a Dancer for Adult Entertainment business,
Dancer, or other similar permit or license denied, revoked or suspended for any
of the above causes by the City or any other state or local agency within five
years prior to the date of the application;
   (f)    The applicant, if an individual, or any of the officers and
directors, if the applicant is a corporation, or any of the partners, including
limited partners, if the applicant is a partnership, and the manager or other
person principally in charge of the operation of the business, is not over the
age of eighteen years.
      (Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.11 DISPLAY OF PERMITS.
   The Dancers for Adult Entertainment business permittee shall display his
permit, and that of each and every dancer employed in the establishment, in an
open and conspicuous place on the premises of the business. (Ord. 93-8660.
Passed 3-18-93.)
705.12 FEE.
   The permit fee of a dancer for adult entertainment business shall be one
thousand dollars ($1,000) per year or any part thereof. The permit fee for
dancers shall be one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) per year or any part
thereof.
(Ord. 01-9301. Passed 3-7-01.)
705.13 REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION OF PERMIT.
   Any Dancers for Adult Entertainment business or Dancer’s permit issued under
this chapter shall be subject to suspension or revocation by the Police Chief
for violation of any provision of this chapter, or for any grounds that would
warrant the denial of issuance of such permit in the first place. The Chief of
Police or Director of Administration, upon such revocation or suspension, shall
state his reasons in writing, specifying the particular grounds for revocation
or suspension.
(Ord. 93-8660. Passed 3-18-93.)
705.14 TRANSFERS PROHIBITED.
   No Dancer for Adult Entertainment business or Dancer permits are
transferable, separate or divisible, and such authority as a permit confers
shall be conferred only on the permittee named therein. (Ord. 93-8660. Passed
3-18-93.)
705.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates Sections
705.08 or
705.09 is guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree.
   (b)    Whoever violates any other provision of this chapter is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree; a separate offense shall be deemed committed
on each day during or on which violation occurs or continues. (Ord. 93-8660.
Passed 3-18-93.)
CHAPTER 709
Advertising
709.01   Unlawful distribution of advertising literature generally.
709.02   Ringing doorbells.
709.03   Posting or painting of advertisements and signs.
709.04   Attaching advertisement to utility poles.
709.05   Political advertising.
709.06   Use of loudspeakers or amplifiers on vehicles.
709.07   Destroying official notices, advertising posters.
709.99   Penalty.
 
 
709.01 UNLAWFUL DISTRIBUTION OF ADVERTISING LITERATURE GENERALLY.
   No person shall distribute, scatter, pass out or deliver any bills,
handbills, advertisements, posters, advertising literature, dodgers, circulars
or documents on the streets or other places in the City, or cause the same to
be distributed, scattered, passed out or delivered in the City or employ any
person for such purpose. (1973 Code §117.01)
709.02 RINGING DOORBELLS.
   No person distributing handbills, circulars or other advertisements, shall
ring the doorbell, sound the door knocker or otherwise call the inmate of any
residence to the door for the purpose of receiving such handbill, circular or
other advertisement which he may be distributing. No person shall hire any
other person to distribute any handbill, circular or other advertisement
contrary to the provisions of this section.
(1973 Code §117.02)
709.03  POSTING OR PAINTING OF ADVERTISEMENTS AND SIGNS.
   No person shall:
   (a)   Stick or post any advertisement, poster, sign, handbill, placard or
literature of any description upon any public or private building, or upon any
tree, post, fence, billboard, sidewalk, curbstone, street or any grounds or
other structure or thing whatsoever, the property of another, without
permission of the occupant or owner of the same.
   (b)   Paint, mark, write, print, impress or in any manner attach any notice
or advertisement, or the name of any commodity or thing, or any trademark,
symbol or figure of any kind upon or to any sidewalk, step or stone, or
anything whatsoever the property of another, without first obtaining permission
of the owner thereof. (Ord. 49-1444. Passed 12-15-49.)
709.04 ATTACHING ADVERTISEMENT TO UTILITY POLES.
   No person shall stick, post or attach any poster, sign, advertisement,
handbill, literature or placard of any description upon or against any
telegraph, telephone or other utility pole within the limits of the City
without first having obtained permission from the Mayor.
(Ord. 49-1444. Passed 12-15-49.)
709.05 POLITICAL ADVERTISING.
   No person shall:
   (a)   Post or attach any poster, bill, leaflet, literature or other written
or printed matter advertising or announcing the candidacy of any person for
nomination or election to any public office, in or upon the municipal building,
police station, fire station, or in or upon any other City-owned building, or
in any public park, public playground or recreational center owned or under the
control of the City.
   (b)   Paint any sign or advertising upon any public building, sidewalk,
street or other City-owned property, advertising or announcing the candidacy of
any person or for nomination or election to any public office.
      (Ord. 40-640. Passed 6-4-40.)
709.06 USE OF LOUDSPEAKERS OR AMPLIFIERS ON VEHICLES.
   No person shall use loudspeakers or amplifiers on trucks or other vehicles
within the limits of the City for advertising. (Ord. 47-1205. Passed 6-4-47.)
709.07 DESTROYING OFFICIAL NOTICES, ADVERTISING POSTERS.
   No person shall tear down, remove, destroy, cover up, mutilate, obliterate
or otherwise injure any proclamation or official notice, any sign or any
handbill, notice, poster or advertisement containing a notice of any meeting,
lecture, theater show, play, concert or any entertainment, or any public or
private sale of property, which may be lawfully placed, posted or put up in the
City, until after the same shall have served the purpose desired.
(1973 Code §117.07)
709.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor.
CHAPTER 713
Coffee Houses
713.01   Hours of operation.
 
 
713.01 HOURS OF OPERATION.
   No person shall enter or pass out of or remain in any coffee house in the
City, between the hours of 11:00 p.m. and 5:00 a.m. on any day of the week.
(1973 Code §113.01)
CHAPTER 717
Junk Dealers
717.01   Definitions.
717.02   Junk dealer’s license required.
717.03   Qualifications; fee and bond.
717.04   Junk collector’s license required.
717.05   Fee for junk collector’s license.
717.06   Display on vehicle.
717.07   Restriction on location of junk shops.
717.08   Loans prohibited.
717.09   Signs.
717.10   Records.
717.11   Daily reports.
717.12   Time limits; tagging.
717.13   Sale of articles by junk collectors.
717.14   Dealing with minor or apprentice.
717.15   Business hours.
717.16   Dealing with drunkards or thieves.
717.17   Fencing.
717.18   Cleanliness.
717.19   Inspections.
717.20   Burning junk.
717.21   Dismantling old automobiles.
717.22   Storage of junk.
717.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Pawnbrokers - see BUS. REG. Ch.
729
 
 
717.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   “Junk dealer” means any person who exercises or carries on the
business of a keeper of a junk shop, or what is commonly called a junk shop,
for the purchase and sale of junk, rags, old rope, paper, bagging, old iron,
brass, copper, tin, empty bottles, slush or lead, but not including plow irons,
old stoves and furniture.
   (b)   “Junk collector” means any person who collects and transports scrap,
old iron, or other metal, glass, paper, cordage, old rubber, junked
automobiles, or other waste or discarded material, which may be prepared to be
used again in some form by means of horse and wagon, motor vehicle, or hand-
propelled conveyance.
(Ord. 34-17. Passed 1-5-34; Ord. 37-190. Passed 5-18-37.)
717.02 JUNK DEALER’S LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall exercise or carry on the business of a junk dealer, as
defined in Section 
717.01  without having first secured from the Mayor a license to do so.
(Ord. 37-190. Passed 5-18-37.)
717.03 QUALIFICATIONS; FEE AND BOND.
   The Mayor is hereby authorized to grant the license required by Section
717.02  to any applicant therefor who is of good character and is a resident
and citizen of the City, upon the payment by such applicant of a license fee in
the sum of one hundred dollars ($100.00) per annum, and the execution by such
applicant of a bond to the City in the penal sum of five hundred dollars
($500.00), with sufficient surety to be approved by the Mayor, and conditioned
that he will faithfully observe the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 37-190. Passed 5-18-37.)
717.04 JUNK COLLECTOR’S LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall engage in business as a junk collector, as defined in
Section
717.01 , without first having secured from the Mayor a license to do so, and
paying in advance the amount of such license fee as provided in Section
717.05 .
(Ord. 34-17. Passed 1-5-34.)
717.05 FEE FOR JUNK COLLECTOR’S LICENSE.
   The license fee to be charged for a junk collector’s license shall be
twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per year. (Ord. 34-17. Passed 1-5-34.)
717.06 DISPLAY ON VEHICLE.
   The license of a junk collector shall be displayed upon his vehicle in such
manner as to be easily seen. (Ord. 34-17. Passed 1-5-34.)
717.07 RESTRICTION ON LOCATION OF JUNK SHOPS.
   No junk dealer shall maintain a junk shop within 200 feet of any inhabited
residence and the lot on which it is situated without the written consent of
the owner of such residence, unless such residence is the property of such
person, or within 500 feet of any school, church or playground. (Ord. 37-190.
Passed 5-18-37.)
717.08 LOANS PROHIBITED.
   No junk dealer shall receive in the line of his business any article by way
of pledge, or pawn, nor shall any such dealer loan or advance any sum of money
on the security of any article or thing.
(1973 Code §118.08)
717.09 SIGNS.
   Every person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall put in a
conspicuous place in or upon his shop, store, wagon, boat or other place of
business a sign with his name and occupation legibly inscribed thereon. (1973
Code §118.09)
717.10 RECORDS.
   Every person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall keep a
separate book ,open to inspection by any member of the Police Department, or to
any other authorized person, in which shall be written in the English language
at the time of every purchase or exchange of any of the articles mentioned in
Section
717.01  a description thereof, the name, description and residence of the
person from whom purchased and received, and the day and hour when such
purchase or exchange was made. Each entry shall be numbered consecutively
commencing with number one.
(1973 Code §118.10)
717.11 DAILY REPORTS.
   Every person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall prepare and
deliver every day to the Mayor before the hour of 12:00 noon a legible and
correct copy written in English, from the book required by Section
717.10  a description of all articles purchased or received during the
preceding day, together with the hour at which each purchase was made and a
description of the person from whom the same was purchased. (1973 Code §118.11)
717.12 TIME LIMITS; TAGGING.
   All articles purchased or exchanged by a junk dealer, as defined in Section 
717.01  shall be retained by him for at least thirty days before disposing of
the same. Such articles shall be kept in an accessible place in the building
where such articles are purchased or received. A tag shall be attached to each
article in some visible and convenient place, with the number written thereon
corresponding to the entry number on the book required by Section
717.10.
(1973 Code §118.12)
717.13 SALE OF ARTICLES BY JUNK COLLECTORS.
   A junk collector, as defined in Section
717.01  may sell articles purchased or obtained by exchange or otherwise at any
time, provided he shall, on Monday of each week, file with the Mayor of the
City a copy of the record required by Section
717.10  to be kept in a separate book, of the articles purchased or received
during the preceding week, including such full description of all such articles
sold, to whom sold, and his place of business.
(1973 Code §118.13)
717.14 DEALING WITH MINOR OR APPRENTICE.
   No person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall directly or
indirectly purchase or receive by way of barter or exchange, or otherwise, any
of the articles mentioned in Section
717.01  from any minor or apprentice, knowing or having reason to believe him
to be such.
(1973 Code §118.14)
717.15 BUSINESS HOURS.
   No person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall purchase or
receive any articles from any person whatsoever between the hours of 9:00 p.m.
and 7:00 a.m.
(1973 Code §118.15)
717.16 DEALING WITH DRUNKARDS OR THIEVES.
   No person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall purchase
anything whatsoever from any person who is at the time intoxicated, or from an
habitual drunkard, or from any person known to them to be a thief or an
associate of thieves, or a receiver of stolen property, or from any person they
have reason to suspect of being such.
(1973 Code §118.16)
717.17 FENCING.
   (a)   No person shall maintain a junk yard or junk shop within the corporate
limits of the City unless such business is carried on entirely inside a
building, or unless the premises on which such business is carried on, be
entirely enclosed by a substantially built fence at least seven feet in height,
except where such junk yard or junk shop abuts upon a railroad right of way
having spur tracks serving the portion of such road. Under such circumstances
no fence will be required on that portion of the property so used abutting upon
the right of way of the railroad.
   (b)   Such fence and its construction for the purpose intended must meet
with the approval of the City Engineer. Such fence shall be maintained in a
neat, safe condition and shall be painted. Gates for access to the premises
shall swing inwardly and such gates shall be closed when the premises are not
open for business. All fences or buildings which serve as enclosures of junk
yards shall be erected not closer than the setback line established on the
street.
(1973 Code §118.17)
717.18 CLEANLINESS.
   All premises used as a junk yard or junk shop shall be kept and maintained
in as clean, sanitary and neat a condition as such business will reasonably
permit. The person operating a junk yard or junk shop shall maintain the
premises so used so that rats, vermin and fire hazard are as far as practicable
reduced to a minimum.
(1973 Code §118.18)
717.19 INSPECTIONS.
   It shall be the duty of the Fire Chief to inspect or cause to be inspected
at least once every four months all junk yards and junk shops in the City. Such
inspection shall be for the purpose of seeing that such premises are operated
in conformity with the provisions of this chapter and other ordinances
applicable, and that they are kept in a safe, sanitary condition.
(1973 Code §118.19)
717.20 BURNING JUNK.
   (a)   No rubbish or portion or parts of wrecked machines and other
accumulations which are to be discarded by a junk dealer shall be burned on his
premises without the written consent of the Fire Chief.
   (b)   No fire disposing of material accumulated in the yards shall be
created less than thirty feet from any building. Where the yard in which such
junk business is conducted is so small as to not permit compliance with this
restriction such person so operating such yard is required to build an
incinerator within which the fires may be started to dispose of such refuse or
other material desired to be destroyed by fire, or cleaned in such manner from
grease and other collections. (1973 Code §118.20)
717.21 DISMANTLING OLD AUTOMOBILES.
   No junk dealers, part of whose business is that of disposing of old,
obsolete or wrecked automobiles and dismantling same, shall perform any of such
work in the streets or upon sidewalks adjoining their yards or permit or cause
to be placed upon sidewalks or streets adjacent to the property used by them as
junk yards any oil, grease or other like material from the automobiles, or
parts thereof, making dangerous use of same by the citizens, and no automobiles
shall be piled one upon the other in the yard, nor shall the chassis or other
parts of the dismantled cars be piled in a manner adjacent to the street line
liable to cause injury or damage in the use of the street or sidewalk, as a
result of junk so piled slipping or falling into the fence and onto the
sidewalk or street. (1973 Code §118.21)
717.22  STORAGE OF JUNK.
   No junk shall be stored in the City unless the same be in a building or
enclosed yard. Such junk so stored, whether inside of building or enclosed
yard, shall be so piled or placed that adequate passageways are open. Junk
piled in an enclosed yard shall not be piled closer than five feet in distance
from the fence enclosing the yard.
(1973 Code §118.22)
717.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree.

CHAPTER 721
Licensing and Operation of Entertainment
721.01   License required; exceptions.
721.02   License fees; exceptions.
721.03   License issuance; contents; record to be kept.
721.04   Inspection requirements.
721.05   Noncompliance.
721.06   Location.
 
 
721.01 LICENSE REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS.
   No person, firm, corporation, or partnership shall act, exhibit, play, or
perform any farce, play, drama, comedy, opera or other theatrical performance,
circus, feats of horsemanship, menagerie, exhibition of animals, amusement
house, haunted house, fun house, panorama, drama, concert, or other exhibition,
entertainment show, moving picture show, or amusement of whatever name or
nature for which money or other reward is in any manner demanded or received
without first obtaining a license therefor issued by the Mayor.
(Ord. 92-8630. Passed 12-16-92.)
721.02 LICENSE FEES; EXCEPTIONS.
   (a)   Each of the following license fees shall be paid to the Mayor where
applicable at the time of application:
      (1)    For-any amusement house, haunted house, or fun house ten dollars
($10.00) per day or fifty dollars ($50.00) per week.
      (2)    For any circus, show, menagerie, or combination thereof fifty
dollars ($50.00) per day.
      (3)    For all other unspecified exhibitions of any kind whatsoever
licensed under this chapter: fifty dollars ($50.00) per day.
      (4)    The owner, lessee, or manager of any academy of music, public
hall, or building used for any theatrical exhibition (live show) or other
amusement or performance shall obtain an annual license from the License Clerk
which shall expire on September 30th of each year. The fee shall be one hundred
dollars ($100.00) per year or any part of a year.
      (5)    The owner, lessee, or manager of any building used for a motion
picture show shall obtain an annual license from the Clerk which shall expire
on September 30th of each year. The fee shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00)
per year or any part of a year.
   (b)    No license shall be issued to permit any circus, show, menagerie, or
combination thereof to operate within the city of more than fourteen days in
any calendar year, for the same sponsor.
   (c)    No license shall be required for entertainments given by any public
or private school, lectures on historical, literary, or scientific subjects or
concerts, fairs, or exhibitions of paintings or statuary given or made by
residents of the City for benevolent, religious, or charitable purposes.
   (d)    The fees paid at the time of application under this section shall not
be refundable for any reason. (Ord. 92-8630. Passed 12-16-92.)
721.03 LICENSE ISSUANCE; CONTENTS; RECORD TO BE KEPT.
   It shall be the duty of the Mayor, upon payment of the required license fee,
and receipt of the certifications required by this chapter, to issue to any
person of the age of eighteen years or older, a license for any purpose named
in this chapter. Each license shall express upon its face the time and purpose
for which it is issued; the name of the person to whom it is issued; and, if
issued for the use of a hall or building, the person to whom it is issued shall
be designated as owner, lessee, or manager, as the case may be. Each license
shall be signed by the Mayor and he shall keep a record of all licenses issued
by him, which shall state the name of the person to whom such license is
granted, the purpose, date, and length of time for which it is issued and the
amount of money received therefor. (Ord. 92-8630. Passed 12-16-92.)
721.04 INSPECTION REQUIREMENTS.
   No license shall be issued until a certificate of approval has been
delivered to the Mayor from:
   (a)    Health Commissioner stating that the premises have been inspected and
are in compliance with health regulations in regard to the sanitary conditions.
   (b)    Fire Chief stating that the premises have been inspected and are in
compliance with the fire code.
   (c)    Said Health Commissioner and Fire Chief shall cause an inspection to
be made on the subject premises within five days of the filing of an
application for a license and the payment of the application fee.
      (Ord. 92-8630. Passed 12-16-92.)
721.05 NONCOMPLIANCE.
   The Police Chief or the Fire Chief, or their designated officers, shall,
without written notice cause the immediate cessation of any activity described
in Section
721.01 which is being conducted without benefit of a City license as required
in Section
721.01 for the reason of improper and illegal operation. Such activities shall
remain closed until all provisions of this chapter have been complied with.
(Ord. 92-8630. Passed 12-16-92.)
721.06 LOCATION.
   Each business featuring dancers for adult entertainment, is hereby
prohibited from operating within 500 feet of any church, school, (public or
private), library, public playground, park or private residence. (Ord. 92-8630.
Passed 12-16-92.)
CHAPTER 725
Massage Parlors
725.01   Definitions.
725.02   Permits required.
725.03   Application for massage business permit.
725.04   Application for masseur’s permit.
725.05   Approval by Chief of Police.
725.06   Sanitation and safety requirements.
725.07   Location.
725.08   Restrictions.
725.09   Sexual imposition.
725.10   Issuance or denial of massage business permit.
725.11   Display of permits.
725.12   Fee.
725.13   Revocation or suspension of permit.
725.14   Keeping of records.
725.15   Transfers prohibited.
725.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Obscenity and sex offenses - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
533
Video viewing units - see BUS. REG. Ch.
737
 
 
725.01 DEFINITIONS.
   Unless the particular provision or the context otherwise requires, the
definitions and provisions contained in this section shall govern the
construction, meaning and application of words and phrases used in this
chapter.
   (a)    "Employee" means any person over eighteen (18) years of age, other
than a masseur, who renders any service in connection with the operation of a
massage business and receives compensation from the operator of the business or
patrons.
   (b)    "Massage" means any method of treating the superficial parts of a
patron for medical, hygienic, exercise or relaxation purposes by rubbing,
stroking, kneading, tapping, pounding, vibrating or stimulating with the hands
or any instrument, or by the application of air, liquid or vapor baths of any
kind whatever.
   (c)    "Masseur" means any person who engages in the practice of massage as
herein defined. The use of the masculine gender shall include in all cases the
feminine gender as well.
   (d)    "Sexual contact" means any touching of an erogenous zone of another,
including without limitation, the thigh, genitals, buttock, pubic region or, if
such person is a female, a breast, for the purpose of sexually arousing or
gratifying either person, and is not included within the term "massage" as used
herein.
   (e)    "Patron" means any person over eighteen (18) years of age who
receives a massage under such circumstances that it is reasonably expected that
he or she will pay money or give any other consideration therefor.
   (f)    "Recognized School" means any school or institution of learning which
has for its purpose the teaching of theory, method, profession or work of
massage, which school requires a resident course of study of not less than
seventy hours before the student shall be furnished with a diploma or
certificate of graduation from such school following the successful completion
of such course of study or learning.
      (Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.02 PERMITS REQUIRED.
   (a)    Business Permit Required. No person shall engage in or carry on the
business of massage unless he has a valid massage business permit issued by the
City pursuant to the provisions of this chapter for each and every separate
office or place of business conducted by such person.
   (b)   Masseur's Permit Required. No person shall practice massage as a
masseur, employee or otherwise, unless he has a valid and subsisting masseur's
permit issued to him by the City pursuant to the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.03 APPLICATION FOR MASSAGE BUSINESS PERMIT.
   Any person desiring a massage business permit shall file a written
application with the Chief of Police on a form to be furnished by the Chief of
Police. The applicant shall accompany the application with a tender of the
correct permit fee as hereinafter provided and shall, in addition furnish the
following:
   (a)    The type of ownership of the business, i.e., whether individual,
partnership, corporation or otherwise;
   (b)    The name, style and designation under which the business or practice
is to be conducted;
   (c)    The business address and all telephone numbers where the business is
to be conducted;
   (d)    A complete list of the names and residence addresses of all masseurs
and employees in the business and the name and residence address of the manager
or other person principally in charge of the operation of the business;
   (e)    The following personal information concerning the applicant, if an
individual; and concerning each stockholder holding more than ten percent (10%)
of the stock of the corporation, each officer and each director, if the
applicant is a corporation; and concerning the partners, including limited
partners, if the applicant is a partnership; and concerning the manager or
other person principally in charge of the operation of the business:
      (1)   Name, complete residence address and residence telephone numbers.
      (2)   Two previous addresses immediately prior to the present address of
the applicant.
      (3)   Written proof of age.
      (4)   Height, weight, color of hair and eyes, and sex.
      (5)   Two front-face portrait photographs taken within thirty days of the
date of the application and at least two inches by two inches in size.
      (6)   The massage or similar business history and experience, including
but not limited to whether or not such person in previously operating in this
or another city or state under license or permit has had such license or permit
denied, revoked or suspended and the reason therefor, and the business
activities or occupations subsequent to such action of denial, suspension or
revocation.
      (7)   All criminal convictions other than misdemeanor traffic violations,
fully disclosing the jurisdiction in which convicted, and the offense for which
convicted and the circumstances thereof.
      (8)   A complete set of fingerprints taken and to be retained on file by
the Police Chief or his authorized representatives.
      (9)   Diploma, certificate or other written proof of graduation from a
recognized school by the person who shall be directly responsible for the
operation and management of the massage business.
   (f)    Such other information, identification and physical examination of
the person as shall be deemed necessary by the Police Chief to discover the
truth of the matters hereinbefore required to be set forth in the application.
   (g)    Authorization for the City, its agents and employees to seek
information and conduct an investigation into the truth of the statements set
forth in the application and the qualifications of the applicant for the
permit.
   (h)    The names and addresses of three adult residents of the County who
will serve as character references. These references must be persons other than
relatives and business associates.
   (i)    Written declaration by applicant, under penalty of perjury, that the
foregoing information contained in the application is true and correct, such
declaration being duly dated and signed in the City. (Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-
18-86.)
725.04 APPLICATION FOR MASSEUR'S PERMIT.
   Any person desiring a masseur's permit shall file a written application with
the Police Chief on a form to be furnished by the Police Chief. The applicant
shall tender with the application the correct permit fees as hereinafter
provided and shall, in addition, furnish the following:
   (a)    The business address and telephone numbers where the massage is to be
practiced.
   (b)    The following personal information concerning the applicant:
      (1)   Name, complete residence address and residence telephone numbers.
      (2)   The two previous addresses immediately prior to the present address
of the applicant.
      (3)   Written proof of age.
      (4)   Height, weight, color of hair and eye, and sex.
      (5)   Two front-face portrait photographs taken within thirty days of the
date of application and at least two inches by two inches in size.
      (6)   The massage or similar business history and experience, including
but not limited to whether or not such person in previously operating in this
or another city or state under license or permit has had such license or permit
denied, revoked or suspended and the reason therefor, and the business
activities subsequent to such action of denial, suspension or revocation.
      (7)   All criminal convictions other than misdemeanor traffic violations,
fully disclosing the jurisdiction in which convicted, and the offense for which
convicted and the circumstances thereof.
      (8)   A complete set of fingerprints taken and to be retained on file by
the Police Chief or his authorized representative.
      (9)   Diploma, certificate or other written proof of graduation from a
recognized school where the theory, method, profession or work of massage is
taught.
      (10)   A statement in writing from a licensed physician in the State that
he has examined the applicant and believes the applicant to be free of all
communicable diseases.
   (c)    Such other information, identification and physical examination of
the person deemed necessary by the Police Chief in order to discover the truth
of the matters hereinbefore required to be set forth in the application.
   (d)    Authorization for the City, its agents and employees to seek
information and conduct an investigation into the truth of the statements set
forth in the application and the qualifications of the applicant for the
permit.
   (e)    Written declaration by the applicant, under penalty of perjury, that
the foregoing information contained in the application is true and correct,
such declaration being duly dated and signed in the City. (Ord. 86-8124. Passed
6-18-86.)
725.05 APPROVAL BY CHIEF OF POLICE.
   (a)   Upon receiving the application for a massage business or masseur's
permit, the
Police Chief shall conduct an investigation into the applicant's moral
character and personal and criminal history. The Police Chief may, in his
discretion, require a personal interview of the applicant, and such further
information, identification and physical examination of the person as shall
bear on the investigation.
   In the case of applications for massage business permits, the Police Chief
shall cause to be conducted an investigation of the premises where the massage
business is to be carried on, for the purposes of assuring that such premises
comply with all the sanitation requirements as set forth in this chapter and
with the regulations of public health, safety and welfare.
   (b)   Before any permit shall be issued under this chapter, the Police Chief
shall first
sign his approval of the application.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.06 SANITATION AND SAFETY REQUIREMENTS.
   All premises used by permittees hereunder shall be periodically inspected by
the Police Chief and/or an authorized Inspector for safety of the structure and
adequacy of plumbing, ventilation, heating and illumination. The walls shall be
clean and painted with washable, mold- resistant paint in all rooms where water
or steam baths are given. Floors shall be free from any accumulation of dust,
dirt or refuse. All equipment used in the massage operation shall be maintained
in a clean and sanitary condition. Towels, linen and items for personal use of
operators and patrons shall be clean and freshly laundered. Towels, cloths and
sheets shall not be used for more than one patron. Heavy white paper may be
substituted for sheets provided that such paper is changed for every patron. No
massage service or practice shall be carried on within any cubicle, room,
booth, or any area within a massage establishment which is fitted with a door
capable of being locked. Nothing contained herein shall be construed to
eliminate other requirements of statute or ordinance concerning the maintenance
of premises, nor to preclude authorized inspection thereof.
   All premises used by permittees hereunder shall be periodically inspected by
the Police Chief, the Health Commissioner, the Building Inspector and/or their
authorized representative.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.07 LOCATION.
   (a)    Each massage parlor, as hereinabove described, is hereby prohibited
from operating within 500 feet of any church, school (public or private),
library, public playground, park or private residence.
   (b)    Five hundred feet as used hereinabove, shall be determined by
measuring the distance from the nearest property line of the land on which the
proposed licensed premises is located to the nearest property lines of land on
which such institutions or public or private places as hereinabove described
are located.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.08 RESTRICTIONS.
   Each massage parlor, as hereinabove described, is hereby prohibited from the
sale of intoxicating liquor upon the premises.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.09 SEXUAL IMPOSITION.
   No person shall, while in the course of a massage, have sexual contact with
another, not the spouse of the offender, when any of the following apply:
   (a)   The offender knows that the sexual contact is offensive to the other
person, or is reckless in that regard.
   (b)   The offender knows that the other person's ability to appraise the
nature or the control of the offender's conduct is substantially impaired.
   (c)   The offender knows that the other person submits because of being
unaware of the sexual contact.
   (d)   The other person is over twelve but not over fifteen years of age,
whether or not the offender knows the age of such person and the offender is at
least eighteen years of age and four or more years older than the other person.
      (Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.10 ISSUANCE OR DENIAL OF MASSAGE BUSINESS PERMIT.
   The Police Chief shall issue a massage business permit within forty-five
days of receipt of the application unless he finds that:
   (a)    The correct permit fee has not been tendered to the City, and, in the
case of a check or bank draft, honored with payment upon presentation;
   (b)    The operation, as proposed by the applicant, if permitted, would not
comply with all applicable laws, including, but not limited to, the City's
building, zoning and health regulations;
   (c)   The applicant, if an individual; or any of the stockholders holding
more than ten percent (10%) of the stock of the corporation, or any of the
officers and directors, if the applicant is a corporation; or any of the
partners, including limited partners, if the applicant is a partnership; and
the manager or other person principally in charge of the operation of the
business, have been convicted of any crime involving dishonesty, fraud, or
deceit, unless conviction occurred at least five years prior to the date of the
application;
   (d)    The applicant has knowingly made any false, misleading or fraudulent
statement of fact in the permit application or in any document required by the
City in conjunction therewith;
   (e)    The applicant has had a massage business, masseur, or other similar
permit or license denied, revoked or suspended for any of the above causes by
the City or any other state or local agency within five years prior to the date
of the application;
   (f)    The applicant, if an individual; or any of the officers and
directors, if the applicant is a corporation; or any of the partners, including
limited partners, if the applicant is a partnership; and the manager or other
person principally in charge of the operation of the business, is not over the
age of eighteen years; and
   (g)    The manager or other person principally in charge of the operation of
the business has not successfully completed a resident course of study or
learning of not less than seventy hours from a recognized school where the
theory, method, profession or work of massage is taught.
      (Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.11 DISPLAY OF PERMITS.
   The massage business permittee shall display his permit, and that of each
and every masseur employed in the establishment, in an open and conspicuous
place on the premises of the massage business. (Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.12 FEE.
   The permit fee for a massage business shall be two hundred and fifty dollars
($250.00) per year or any part thereof. The permit fee for masseurs shall be
seventy-five dollars ($75.00) per year or any part thereof. (Ord. 86-8124.
Passed 6-18-86.)
725.13 REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION OF PERMIT.
   Any massage business or masseur's permit issued under this chapter shall be
subject to suspension or revocation by the Police Chief for violation of any
provision of this chapter, or for any grounds that would warrant the denial of
issuance of such permit in the first place. The Chief, upon such revocation or
suspension, shall state his reasons in writing, specifying the particular
grounds for such revocation or suspension.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.14 KEEPING OF RECORDS.
   Every person who operates a massage business or practices or provides a
massage shall at all times keep an appointment book in which the name of each
and every patron shall be entered, together with the time, date and place of
service, and the service provided. Such appointment book shall be available at
all times for inspection by the Police Chief and/or his authorized
representative. (Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.15 TRANSFERS PROHIBITED.
   No massage business and masseur permits are transferable, separate or
divisible, and such authority as a permit confers shall be conferred only on
the permittee named therein.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
725.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates Section
725.08 or
725.09 is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
   (b)    Whoever violates any other provision of this chapter is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree; a separate offense shall be deemed committed
on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(Ord. 86-8124. Passed 6-18-86.)
CHAPTER 729
Pawnbrokers
729.01   Pawnbroker defined.
729.02   License required.
729.03   Qualifications; fee and bond.

729.05   Inspection of records and pawned articles by police.
729.06   Daily report to Chief of Police.
729.07   Time that pawned articles may be kept.
729.08   Business hours.
729.09   Minors; intoxicated persons; thieves.
729.10   Other businesses.
729.11   Employment of persons under sixteen.
729.12   Revocation of license.
729.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Junk dealers - see BUS. REG. Ch.
717
 
 
729.01 PAWNBROKER DEFINED.
   Any person engaged in the business of lending money on deposit or pledge of
personal property or other valuable thing, other than securities or printed
evidence of indebtedness, or in the business of purchasing personal property,
or choses in action, or other valuable thing, and selling or agreeing to sell
the same back to the seller at a price other than the original price of
purchase, or in the business of purchasing personal property such as articles
made of or containing gold, silver, platinum or other precious metals or jewels
of any description for the purpose of reducing or smelting them into any form
different from their condition or construction when purchased and reselling or
marketing the product, is a pawnbroker within the meaning of this chapter.
(1973 Code §119.01)
729.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall carry on or conduct the business or calling of a pawnbroker,
as defined in Section
729.01  without first having obtained from the Mayor a license to do so.
(1973 Code §119.02)
729.03 QUALIFICATIONS; FEE AND BOND.
   The Mayor may grant a pawnbroker’s license to any person of good moral
character who may apply therefor, upon payment by such applicant of a license
fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) per annum, and upon the execution by such
applicant of a bond, to the satisfaction of the Mayor, in the sum of five
hundred dollars ($500.00) conditioned that he will conform to the requirements
of this chapter, the laws of the State and any other ordinances of the City.
(1973 Code §119.03)
729.04 RECORDS.
   Every person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall keep a
correct list and description, in a book for that purpose, of every article
pledged or deposited with him, or on which advances of money have been made, or
which may be purchased by him. He shall also register in such book the name and
place of residence of the depositor and the time when the deposit was made. All
the entries shall be written in ink in the English language, and no entry shall
be erased, obliterated or defaced. (1973 Code §119.04)
729.05 INSPECTION OF RECORDS AND PAWNED ARTICLES BY POLICE.
   The list and description required by Section
729.04  shall at all times be open to the inspection of the Chief of Police, or
of a police officer deputized by him or by the Mayor to make such inspection.
Every pawnbroker shall, at all times, when required by the police or Mayor as
provided herein, produce and show any article so listed and described which may
be in his possession. (1973 Code §119.05)
729.06 DAILY REPORT TO CHIEF OF POLICE.
   Every person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall prepare and
deliver to the Chief of Police every day before the hour of 12:00 midnight, a
legible and correct copy from such registry of the description of all personal
property, bonds, notes or other securities received on deposit or purchased
during the preceding day, together with the hour at which the article was
received and the description of the person by whom left in pledge or from whom
the same was purchased. (1973 Code §119.06)
729.07 TIME THAT PAWNED ARTICLES MAY BE KEPT.
   No bond, note, security or personal property of any kind received on
deposit, purchased or pledged by any pawnbroker shall be sold or permitted to
be redeemed or removed from the place of business of such pawnbroker for a
period of twenty-four hours after the copy and statement provided for in
Section
729.06  have been delivered.
(1973 Code §119.07)
729.08 BUSINESS HOURS.
   No person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall receive on
deposit, or purchase, any personal property, bonds, notes, securities or
article, property or thing, as such pawnbroker before the hour of 6:00 a.m. or
after the hour of 8:00 p.m. during the months of January, February, March,
April, October, November and December of each year; or before the hour of 5:00
a.m. or after the hour of 9:00 p.m. during the months of May, June, July,
August and September of each year. (1973 Code §119.08)
729.09 MINORS; INTOXICATED PERSONS; THIEVES.
   No person licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall take or
receive in pawn or pledge for money loaned, or shall take, receive or purchase
within the line of his business as a pawnbroker, any property, bonds, notes,
securities, articles or thing whatsoever, from any minor, on the ownership of
which is in or which is claimed by any minor, or which may be in the possession
or under the control of any minor, or a person appearing to be intoxicated, a
person known to be a notorious thief, or a person known to have been convicted
of larceny or burglary.
(1973 Code §119.09)
729.10  OTHER BUSINESSES.
   No pawnbroker shall carry on any other business or vocation, directly or
indirectly, in the same building in which the business of pawnbroking is
carried on.
(1973 Code §119.10)
729.11 EMPLOYMENT OF PERSONS UNDER SIXTEEN.
   No pawnbroker shall employ any person under the age of sixteen years to take
pledges in pawn. (1973 Code §119.11)
729.12 REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   The Mayor shall revoke the license of any person who is convicted of a
violation of any of the provisions of this chapter. (1973 Code §119.12)
729.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
five hundred dollars ($500.00), or imprisoned for six months, or both. Each day
such violation continues shall constitute a separate offense. (1973 Code
§119.99)
CHAPTER 733
Peddlers
733.01   License required.
733.02   Display of license.
733.03   Transferability and revocation of license; number.
733.04   License fees.
733.05   Loud noises and speaking devices prohibited.
733.06   Exemptions.
733.99   Penalty.
 
 
733.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall engage in the business of selling or offering for sale by
soliciting orders from house to house, or from any motor vehicle, hand-
propelled vehicle or any other vehicle or stand, any wares of whatsoever kind
to private consumers, whether by huckstering, peddling, hawking or as a
traveling merchant, solicitor or agent within the City, without first having
secured a license from the Mayor to do so.
(Ord. 50-1542. Passed 11-16-50.)
733.02 DISPLAY OF LICENSE.
   The license required by Section
733.01  shall be displayed upon the vehicle of the licensee in such a manner as
to be readily discernible or, in the case of a licensee who travels on foot
while selling his wares, such license shall be produced immediately for
inspection upon demand by a proper enforcement officer. (Ord. 50-1542. Passed
11-16-50.)
733.03 TRANSFERABILITY AND REVOCATION OF LICENSE; NUMBER.
   The license required by Section
733.01  shall not be transferable and may be revoked by the Mayor for
misconduct of the person to whom issued. No person shall take out more than one
license in his own name nor shall any person operate under a license issued in
the name of another. (Ord. 50-1542. Passed 11-16-50.)
733.04 LICENSE FEES.
   The fees for the licenses required under this chapter shall be according to
the following schedule:
   (a)   Selling from house to house by sample or otherwise, $3.00 per day;
$9.00 per week; $15.00 per month; $25.00 per quarter; and $75.00 per year.
   (b)   Selling on the streets from motor vehicle, hand-propelled vehicle or
any other vehicle, $5.00 per day; $15.00 per week; $30.00 per month; $75.00 per
quarter; and $150.00 per year. (Ord. 50-1542. Passed 11-16-50.)
733.05 LOUD NOISES AND SPEAKING DEVICES PROHIBITED.
   No peddler nor any person on his behalf, shall shout, make any outcry, blow
a horn, ring a bell or chimes or use any sound device, imbibing any loud
speaking radio or sound amplifying system upon any of the streets, alleys,
parks or other public places of said City or upon any private premises in the
City where sound of sufficient volume is emitted or produced therefrom to be
capable of being plainly heard upon the streets, avenues, alleys, parks or
other public places, for the purpose of attracting attention to any goods,
wares, products or merchandise which such peddler proposes to sell. (Ord. 62-
5191. Passed 6-14-62.)
733.06  EXEMPTIONS.
   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to the agents or salesmen of
wholesale houses or firms selling or offering to sell, their wares or
merchandise by sample to merchants in the City, nor to farmers selling or
offering for sale the products of their own farms.
(Ord. 50-1542. Passed 11-16-50.)
733.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
five hundred dollars($500.00), or imprisoned for six months, or both. Each day
such violation continues shall constitute a separate offense. (1973 Code
§120.99)
CHAPTER 737
Video Viewing Units
737.01   Definitions.
737.02   License required.
737.03   Location and restrictions.
737.04   License fee; transfer and display.
737.05   Contents of license.
737.06   Regulations.
737.07   Revocation of license; hearing procedure.
737.99   Penalty.
 
 
737.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   "Exhibitor" means any person or their agent, owning, exhibiting,
contracting for or permitting any electronically or mechanically operated
device as defined in this section to be installed, used or operated in his/her
place of business irrespective of the ownership of such device.
   (b)   "Electronically or mechanically operated device" means a machine
which, upon the insertion of a coin, slug, U.S. paper currency or other
currency is operated for viewing images of a pornographic or obscene nature.
   (c)   "Adult Video Store" means any commercial establishment in which one of
the primary functions is the sale of film or other medium that offers for
viewing or permits the viewing of such medium which depicts nudity, sex, the
use of children, animals or other pornographic or obscene material.
   (d)   “Adult theater or adult movie house" means any theater or other
establishment which shows films rated X, NX-17 or any movie theater or adult
theater which presents for public viewing adult films or adult performances or
depicts for viewing the use of adults with children or any combination thereof
or adults or children with animals or any combination thereof depicting nudity,
excretion or sexual conduct.
   (e)   "Commercial establishment" means any building which designed to permit
public viewing of film or other medium which depicts nudity, sexual conduct,
excretion or use of animals by way of video units, mechanical or electrically
operated and accepting coins, slug, U.S. paper currency or other medium to
operate it.
   (f)   "Owner" means any person having title to any such mechanical or
electrically operated machines which depict pornographic or obscene material
and/or the owner's agent.
   (g)   "Pornographic and/or obscene" means that material which appeals to the
prurient interest and which has a tendency to excite lustful thoughts. Further
being such material which is patently offensive to the prevailing or
contemporary standards of the adult community in Campbell.
   (h)   "Minor" is that person who is below the age of majority as currently
defined by the Legislature of the State of Ohio.
(Ord. 92-8542. Passed 1-2-92.)
737.02  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)   No exhibitor, owner or their agent shall operate or permit the
operation of video devices, as defined in this chapter, within the City of
Campbell without first obtaining a license co-signed by the Mayor and the
Administrator. Every exhibitor or owner shall make an application in writing to
the Mayor, which application shall set forth:
      (1)   The name under which the business is to be conducted.
      (2)   The location the business is to be carried on.
      (3)   The name and address of any manager, adult supervisor or other
employee.
      (4)   The name and address of the owner or owners of the coin operated
devices, and
      (5)   The name, address and principal occupation of every person with an
interest in the business. If the business is conducted by:
         A.   A sole proprietorship, the name, address and principal occupation
of that individual.
         B.   An unincorporated association, the names, addresses and principal
occupation of each officer.
         C.   A corporation, the names and addresses and principal occupation
of all officers.
   (b)   The Mayor and Administrator shall not issue a license to any person,
partnership, corporation or other entity if any of the persons with an interest
in the business or if any of the employees of the business have been convicted
of a violation of a Federal or State statute or of any local ordinance
pertaining to gambling or other crime of moral turpitude within five years
preceding the application. Also, as a prerequisite to the issue of such
license, an inspection shall be made of the premises by the Building Inspector,
the Fire Department, and the Public Health Department and approval must be had
from each of such agencies.
(Ord. 92-8542. Passed 1-2-92.)
737.03 LOCATION AND RESTRICTIONS.
   (a)   No license shall be granted to an exhibitor that will conduct its
business at a location that is within five hundred (500) feet from the
boundaries of a parcel of real estate having situated on it a school, public
library, public playground, church or residence.
   (b)   No one eighteen years or younger shall be employed or be permitted to
work in such adult video store, adult movie theater or other commercial
establishment as defined in this chapter.
   (c)   No one eighteen years or younger shall enter or be permitted to enter
such adult video store, adult movie theater or other commercial establishment
as defined in this chapter.
(Ord. 92-8542. Passed 1-2-92.)
737.04 LICENSE FEE; TRANSFER AND DISPLAY.
   (a)   The license fee payable to the City of Campbell at the time of
application shall be as follows:
      (1)   The sum of one thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500) for the first
such device as defined in this chapter for the year or any part thereof ending
on December 31, of each year.
      (2)   The sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000) for each device thereafter
for the year or any part thereof ending on December 31, of each year.
   This fee shall be paid at the time of application and is not refundable in
any case.
   (b)   Licenses issued under this chapter shall not be transferrable to any
other person, partnership, corporation, or other entity and the business may be
conducted only at the site for which the license is issued. The license must be
so placed as to be made conspicuously visible.
   (c)   Any person who does not comply with this chapter, in addition to other
penalties established, shall not be permitted to apply or reapply for a license
for a period of 365 days from the date of violation of this chapter is
discovered.
(Ord. 92-8542. Passed 1-2-92.)
737.05 CONTENTS OF LICENSE.
   Upon approval of the application requested by this chapter, the Mayor and
Director of Administration shall issue a license and registration which shall
contain the name and address of the licensee, the number of mechanically or
electrically operated devices exhibited, the address at which it is desired to
exhibit and operate the device, the nature of the business conducted at such
place, the make, name, model and other identifying information with reference
to the particular device to be exhibited, the serial number of the license, and
such other information as the Mayor in his discretion, may require.
(Ord. 92-8542. Passed 1-2-92.)
737.06 REGULATIONS.
   The Mayor is authorized and empowered to establish, adopt and enforce or
cause to be enforced such rules and regulations governing the issuance of the
licenses required under this chapter as he may deem reasonable and necessary
and not inconsistent with the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 92-8542. Passed
1-2-92.)
737.07 REVOCATION OF LICENSE; HEARING PROCEDURE.
   The license may be suspended or revoked at any time by the Director of
Administration on satisfactory proof that violation of the laws of the State,
Ordinances of the City, rules and regulations or of this chapter occurs on the
premises.
(Ord. 92-8542. Passed 1-2-92.)
737.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Any person who offers for use or has on his premises one or more
electronically or mechanically operated video viewing units displaying
pornographic or obscene material for use; for which a license has not been
obtained, shall be subject to closure by the City and further subject to all
other permits or licenses being revoked.
   (b)   Whoever violates any section or sections of this chapter is guilty of
a misdemeanor of the first degree, punishable by a fine not to exceed one
thousand dollars ($1,000), six months incarceration, or both.
(Ord. 92-8542. Passed 1-2-92.)

741.01   Signs.
741.99   Penalty.
